author: Alok Deshpande
text:
When the Maharashtra government cited the 2011 golden jubilee celebrations at Girgaum Chowpatty to push for Sunday night’s gala, Maharashtra Rajni, as part of the ongoing Make in India event, it chose to overlook a caveat — that the approval for the jubilee fest should not be held up as an example to hold similar events in future.

The committee appointed by the Bombay High Court for chowpatty in 2011 said: “This function shall not be cited as a precedent for future and is to be treated as a special case being the State government’s golden jubilee function.”

When The Hindu sought the government’s reason for opting for Girgaum Chowpatty, a senior official said that the decision was to present the culture of the city at a historical place like this.
title: Warning overlooked
